attributes.action: Scrap the University tuition fee conpletly
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Government is set on higher university attendance; however, many people find tuition fees off-putting.
If a student enrols on a 4 year degree course, the tuition fee loan will total £12,580. Factor in £100 a week for accommodation (£3,800 a year) and £80 a week for general living (£3,040 a year) and this figure jumps to £39,940 for a 4 year course. This is of course taken out as a loan from the SLC, a government body. This figure is still small as I have not accounted for interest, or the fact that many students resort to a job to sustain themselves, at expense to the education they are trying to afford. I believe it is morally wrong that the government stand to make a profit off of students - future high earners and those who will later pay taxes.
Other parts of the UK have abolished the fee. This move would bring England into line with Scotland and Wales.
Therefore, I petition the Prime Minister to scrap the tuition fee and replace it with means tested grants to aid living costs.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
